sn47.41:1.2: “Mendicants, you should meditate with your mind firmly established in the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
sn47.41:1.3: Don’t let the deathless escape you.
sn47.41:1.5: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of covetousness and displeasure for the world.
sn47.41:1.6: They meditate observing an aspect of feelings …
sn47.41:1.8: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of covetousness and displeasure for the world.
sn47.41:1.9: You should meditate with your mind firmly established in the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
sn47.41:1.10: Don’t let the deathless escape you.”
